Proof.

Using âˆ‘k,vxvâ¢dâ¢Ï•vâ¢kâ¢d(n)=âˆ‘vxvâ¢d=Î»dsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘ğ‘›subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğœ†ğ‘‘\sum_{k,v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}=\lambda_{d}âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the statement follows by induction. âˆ

Corollary B.2.

Let Xâˆˆâ„+VÃ—Dğ‘‹subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ·X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Î»d=âˆ‘vxvâ¢dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘\lambda_{d}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let (Wâˆ—,NMF,Hâˆ—,NMF)superscriptğ‘ŠNMFsuperscriptğ»NMF(W^{*,\text{NMF}},H^{*,\text{NMF}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point of NMF with a normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W AlgorithmÂ 4. Then (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with W=Wâˆ—,NMFğ‘Šsuperscriptğ‘ŠNMFW=W^{*,\text{NMF}}italic_W = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hkâ¢d=hkâ¢dâˆ—,NMF/Î»dsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘NMFsubscriptğœ†ğ‘‘h_{kd}=h_{kd}^{*,\text{NMF}}/\lambda_{d}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a fixed point of NMF with a normalization constraint on both Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W and Hğ»Hitalic_H / PLSA AlgorithmÂ 6. Conversely, let (Wâˆ—,PLSA,Hâˆ—,PLSA)superscriptğ‘ŠPLSAsuperscriptğ»PLSA(W^{*,\text{PLSA}},H^{*,\text{PLSA}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point of AlgorithmÂ 6. Then (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with W=Wâˆ—,PLSAğ‘Šsuperscriptğ‘ŠPLSAW=W^{*,\text{PLSA}}italic_W = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hkâ¢d=Î»dâ¢hkâ¢dâˆ—,PLSAsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğœ†ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘PLSAh_{kd}=\lambda_{d}h_{kd}^{*,\text{PLSA}}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a fixed point of AlgorithmÂ 4.

Proof.

Follows directly from LemmaÂ B.1 and âˆ‘khkâ¢dâˆ—,NMF=âˆ‘vxvâ¢d=Î»dsubscriptğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘NMFsubscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğœ†ğ‘‘\sum_{k}h_{kd}^{*,\text{NMF}}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}=\lambda_{d}âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any fixed point of AlgorithmÂ 4. âˆ

Appendix C Dirichletâ€“Poisson model

In this section, we derive the variational lower bound of the Dirichletâ€“Poisson model with a normalized topic matrix WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT described in SectionÂ 5. Recall the generative process of the word counts of a single document dğ‘‘ditalic_d:

  1. 1.

    Sample the topic proportions hdâˆ¼Dirâ¡(Î±)similar-tosubscriptâ„ğ‘‘Dirğ›¼h_{d}\sim\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ).

  2. 2.

    Sample the topic contributions zvâ¢kâ¢dâˆ¼Poissonâ¡(wvâ¢kâ¢hkâ¢d)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Poissonsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘z_{vkd}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{kd})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  3. 3.

    Xvâ¢d=âˆ‘kzvâ¢kâ¢dsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘X_{vd}=\sum_{k}z_{vkd}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Under this model, the joint likelihood of the observed counts xdsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘x_{d}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the latent variables (hd,zd)subscriptâ„ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘(h_{d},z_{d})( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is given by

pâ¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Î±)=(âˆvğŸ™âˆ‘kzvâ¢kâ¢d=xvâ¢d)â¢pâ¢(hd|Î±)â¢âˆv,kpâ¢(zvâ¢kâ¢d|W,hd),ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘ğ‘Šğ›¼subscriptproductğ‘£subscript1subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘ğ‘conditionalsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘ğ›¼subscriptproductğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘ğ‘Šsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘p(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha)=\Big{(}\prod_{v}\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{k}z_{vkd}=x_{% vd}}\Big{)}p(h_{d}|\alpha)\prod_{v,k}p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d}),italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Î± ) = ( âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î± ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where

pâ¢(zvâ¢kâ¢d|W,hd)=(wvâ¢kâ¢hkâ¢d)zvâ¢kâ¢dâ¢eâˆ’wvâ¢kâ¢hkâ¢dzvâ¢kâ¢d!ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘ğ‘Šsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘superscriptğ‘’subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d})=(w_{vk}h_{kd})^{z_{vkd}}\frac{e^{-w_{vk}h_{kd}}}{z_{vkd}!}italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG

is the probability mass function of the Poisson distribution. Identically to LDA, the introduction of the Dirichlet prior on the topic proportions results in an intractable posterior distribution of the latent variables. We therefore resort to variational inference and approximate the true posterior with a variational distribution qğ‘qitalic_q given by

qâ¢(h,z|Î²,Ï•)=âˆdqdâ¢(hd,zd|Î²d,Ï•d),qdâ¢(hd,zd|Î²d,Ï•d)=qâ¢(hd|Î²d)â¢âˆvqâ¢(zvâ¢d|xvâ¢d,Ï•vâ¢d),formulae-sequenceğ‘â„conditionalğ‘§ğ›½italic-Ï•subscriptproductğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘‘ğ‘conditionalsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptproductğ‘£ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘‘\displaystyle q(h,z|\beta,\phi)=\prod_{d}q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},\phi_{d})% ,\qquad q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},\phi_{d})=q(h_{d}|\beta_{d})\prod_{v}q(z_{% vd}|x_{vd},\phi_{vd}),italic_q ( italic_h , italic_z | italic_Î² , italic_Ï• ) = âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where Î²dsubscriptğ›½ğ‘‘\beta_{d}italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Ï•vâ¢dsubscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘‘\phi_{vd}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are Dirichlet and multinomial parameters, respectively. We will now compute the individual terms of the per-document variational lower bound

When combining all terms except data-dependent constants, the summands involving ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡zvâ¢kâ¢d!]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log z_{vkd}!\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! ] cancel each other and the per-document variational lower bound simplifies to

â„’dDPâ¢(xd|W,Î±,Î²d,Ï•d)subscriptsuperscriptâ„’DPğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘ğ‘Šğ›¼subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘‘\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}_{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,\beta_{d},\phi_{d})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Î± , italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ‘v,kxvâ¢dâ¢Ï•vâ¢kâ¢dâ¢logâ¡wvâ¢kâ¢h~kâ¢dÏ•vâ¢kâ¢d+logâ¡Î“â¢(âˆ‘kÎ±k)âˆ’logâ¡Î“â¢(âˆ‘kÎ²kâ¢d)absentsubscriptğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscript~â„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Î“subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜Î“subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\displaystyle=\sum_{v,k}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd}}{% \phi_{vkd}}\,+\,\log\Gamma(\textstyle{\sum}_{k}\alpha_{k})-\log\Gamma(% \textstyle{\sum}_{k}\beta_{kd})= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + roman_log roman_Î“ ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log roman_Î“ ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
+âˆ‘k(logâ¡Î“â¢(Î²kâ¢d)âˆ’logâ¡Î“â¢(Î±k)+(Î±kâˆ’Î²kâ¢d)â¢ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡hkâ¢d]).subscriptğ‘˜Î“subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\displaystyle\phantom{=}+\displaystyle\sum_{k}\Big{(}\log\Gamma(\beta_{kd})-% \log\Gamma(\alpha_{k})+(\alpha_{k}-\beta_{kd})\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd% }\right]\Big{)}.+ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_log roman_Î“ ( italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) .

Finally, the variational lower bound of the Dirichletâ€“Poisson model is

â„’DPâ¢(X|W,Î±,Î²,Ï•)=âˆ‘dâ„’dDPâ¢(xd|W,Î±,Î²d,Ï•d),superscriptâ„’DPconditionalğ‘‹ğ‘Šğ›¼ğ›½italic-Ï•subscriptğ‘‘subscriptsuperscriptâ„’DPğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘ğ‘Šğ›¼subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘‘\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}(X|W,\alpha,\beta,\phi)=\sum_{d}\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}% _{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,\beta_{d},\phi_{d}),caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | italic_W , italic_Î± , italic_Î² , italic_Ï• ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Î± , italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

which is identical to the variational lower bound (17) of LDA.

Appendix D Equivalent generative models

The connections between NMF and PLSA or LDA exist because of the close relationships of their underlying generative models, which we summarize in this section.

We say that a parameter of a model is trivial if the marginal distribution of the observed variables Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X has a unique global optimum with respect to this parameter that can be immediately estimated from the observations Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X. A model parameter that is not trivial is called non-trivial.

We call two models m1subscriptğ‘š1m_{1}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and m2subscriptğ‘š2m_{2}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT equivalent if they have the same non-trivial model parameters Î¸ğœƒ\thetaitalic_Î¸ and the marginal distributions of the observed variables Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X are identical up to multiplicative and additive constants after estimating the trivial parameters, i.e.,

pÎ¸m1â¢(X)=c1â¢pÎ¸m2â¢(X)+c2subscriptsuperscriptğ‘subscriptğ‘š1ğœƒğ‘‹subscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘subscriptğ‘š2ğœƒğ‘‹subscriptğ‘2p^{m_{1}}_{\theta}(X)=c_{1}p^{m_{2}}_{\theta}(X)+c_{2}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

for some data-dependent constants c1â¢(X),c2â¢(X)âˆˆâ„.subscriptğ‘1ğ‘‹subscriptğ‘2ğ‘‹â„c_{1}(X),c_{2}(X)\in\mathbb{R}.italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) âˆˆ blackboard_R . It is important to note that potentially existing latent variables are allowed to differ.

Lemma D.1.

Let the model parameters be Wâˆˆâ„+VÃ—Kğ‘Šsubscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ¾W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hâˆˆâ„+Kâ„subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾h\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{+}italic_h âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then the following models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    Xvâˆ¼Poissonâ¡((Wâ¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£Poissonsubscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£X_{v}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

  2. (ii)

    zvâ¢kâˆ¼Poissonâ¡(wvâ¢kâ¢hk)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜Poissonsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜z_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{k})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) independent
    Xv=âˆ‘kzvâ¢ksubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜X_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Proof.

For both models, it holds

pâ¢(X1=x1,â€¦,XV=xV|W,h)=eâˆ’âˆ‘v(Wâ¢h)vâ¢âˆv1xv!â¢(Wâ¢h)vxv.ğ‘formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘‹1subscriptğ‘¥1â€¦subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘‰conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‰ğ‘Šâ„superscriptğ‘’subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£subscriptproductğ‘£1subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£superscriptsubscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£p(X_{1}=x_{1},\ldots,X_{V}=x_{V}|W,h)=e^{-\sum_{v}(Wh)_{v}}\prod_{v}\frac{1}{x% _{v}!}(Wh)_{v}^{x_{v}}.italic_p ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h ) = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (31)

âˆ

Lemma D.2.

Let the model parameters be Wâˆˆâ„+VÃ—Kğ‘Šsubscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ¾W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, hâˆˆâ„+Kâ„subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾h\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{+}italic_h âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the total number of observations Nğ‘Nitalic_N.     Xv=âˆ‘kzvâ¢ksubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜X_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Additionally, the total number of observations Nğ‘Nitalic_N is a trivial model parameter. If the columns of Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W are normalized, i.e., WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then (i) and (ii) are also equivalent to

  1. (iii)

    âˆ€n=1,â€¦,Nfor-allğ‘›1â€¦ğ‘\forall n=1,\ldots,Nâˆ€ italic_n = 1 , â€¦ , italic_N:

      znâˆ¼Catâ¡(h)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘›Catâ„z_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(h)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Cat ( italic_h )

    • â€¢

      Î½nâˆ¼Catâ¡(wzn)similar-tosubscriptğœˆğ‘›Catsubscriptğ‘¤subscriptğ‘§ğ‘›\nu_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(w_{z_{n}})italic_Î½ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Cat ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Xv=âˆ‘nğŸ™Î½n=vsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘›subscript1subscriptğœˆğ‘›ğ‘£X_{v}=\sum_{n}\mathbbm{1}_{\nu_{n}=v}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î½ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

For all three models, it holds

pâ¢(X1=x1,â€¦,XV=xV|W,h,N)=ğŸ™âˆ‘vxv=Nâ¢N!âˆvxv!â¢âˆv((Wâ¢h)vâˆ‘vâ€²(Wâ¢h)vâ€²)xv.ğ‘formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘‹1subscriptğ‘¥1â€¦subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘‰conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‰ğ‘Šâ„ğ‘subscript1subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘ğ‘subscriptproductğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£subscriptproductğ‘£superscriptsubscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²subscriptğ‘Šâ„superscriptğ‘£â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£p(X_{1}=x_{1},\ldots,X_{V}=x_{V}|W,h,N)=\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{v}x_{v}=N}\frac{N!}% {\prod_{v}x_{v}!}\prod_{v}\Big{(}\frac{(Wh)_{v}}{\sum_{v^{\prime}}(Wh)_{v^{% \prime}}}\Big{)}^{x_{v}}.italic_p ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h , italic_N ) = blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_N ! end_ARG start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (32)

Note that to see (32) for (ii), the trick is to apply the multinomial theorem

âˆ‘zâˆˆâ„•0Kâˆ‘kzk=xx!âˆkzk!â¢âˆkykzk=(âˆ‘kyk)xsubscriptğ‘§superscriptsubscriptâ„•0ğ¾subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘˜ğ‘¥ğ‘¥subscriptproductğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘˜subscriptproductğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘˜ğ‘¥\sum_{\begin{subarray}{c}z\in\mathbb{N}_{0}^{K}\\ \sum_{k}z_{k}=x\end{subarray}}\frac{x!}{\prod_{k}z_{k}!}\prod_{k}y_{k}^{z_{k}}% =\Big{(}\sum_{k}y_{k}\Big{)}^{x}âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_z âˆˆ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_x ! end_ARG start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

for all xâˆˆâ„•0ğ‘¥subscriptâ„•0x\in\mathbb{N}_{0}italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and yâˆˆâ„Kğ‘¦superscriptâ„ğ¾y\in\mathbb{R}^{K}italic_y âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. âˆ

Lemma D.3.

Let the model parameters be normalized WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hâˆˆÎ”Kâˆ’1â„subscriptÎ”ğ¾1h\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_h âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, or normalized W,hğ‘Šâ„W,hitalic_W , italic_h and the total number of observations Nğ‘Nitalic_N.   1. (i)

    Xvâˆ¼Poissonâ¡((Wâ¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£Poissonsubscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£X_{v}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    zvâ¢kâˆ¼Poissonâ¡(wvâ¢kâ¢hk)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜Poissonsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜z_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{k})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) independent
    Xv=âˆ‘kzvâ¢ksubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜X_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

  3. (iii)

    (Xv)vâˆ¼Multinomialâ¡(N,pv=(Wâ¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£ğ‘£Multinomialğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘£subscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£(X_{v})_{v}\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p_{v}=(Wh)_{v})( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Xv=âˆ‘kzvâ¢ksubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜X_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    âˆ€n=1,â€¦,Nfor-allğ‘›1â€¦ğ‘\forall n=1,\ldots,Nâˆ€ italic_n = 1 , â€¦ , italic_N:

    • â€¢

      znâˆ¼Catâ¡(h)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘›Catâ„z_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(h)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Cat ( italic_h )

      Î½nâˆ¼Catâ¡(wzn)similar-tosubscriptğœˆğ‘›Catsubscriptğ‘¤subscriptğ‘§ğ‘›\nu_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(w_{z_{n}})italic_Î½ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Cat ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Xv=âˆ‘nğŸ™Î½n=vsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£subscriptğ‘›subscript1subscriptğœˆğ‘›ğ‘£X_{v}=\sum_{n}\mathbbm{1}_{\nu_{n}=v}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î½ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Proof.

With observed Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X, trivially estimated Nğ‘Nitalic_N and normalized model parameters, (31) and (32) are identical up to a constant due to âˆ‘v(Wâ¢h)v=1.subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£1\sum_{v}(Wh)_{v}=1.âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 . âˆ

Appendix E Gammaâ€“Poisson model

In this section, we extend the connections between NMF with a normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W (18) and NMF with a normalization constraint on both Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W and Hğ»Hitalic_H (19) / PLSA presented in AppendixÂ B to their Bayesian counterparts: the Gammaâ€“Poisson and the Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA models. We first introduce the Gammaâ€“Poisson model and derive its variational inference algorithm following [7, 6]. Then, we extend the connection between their generative models from [6, Lemma 1] to an algorithmic equivalence of their VI algorithms.

In the Gammaâ€“Poisson model we consider, the topics WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are normalized model parameters. The topic weights hdsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘h_{d}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are not normalized and Gamma priors hkâ¢dâˆ¼Î“â¢(Î±k,ak)similar-tosubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜h_{kd}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for additional model parameters Î±,aâˆˆâ„>0Kğ›¼ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾absent0\alpha,a\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Î± , italic_a âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are introduced. The generative process of each document dğ‘‘ditalic_d then becomes

  1. 1.

    Sample the topic weights hkâ¢dâˆ¼Î“â¢(Î±k,ak)similar-tosubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜h_{kd}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. 2.

    Sample the topic contributions zvâ¢kâ¢dâˆ¼Poissonâ¡(wvâ¢kâ¢hkâ¢d)similar-tosubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘Poissonsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘z_{vkd}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{kd})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  3. 3.

    Xvâ¢d=âˆ‘kzvâ¢kâ¢dsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘X_{vd}=\sum_{k}z_{vkd}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Here and in the following, Î“â¢(Î±k,ak)Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) denotes the Gamma distribution with shape parameter Î±ksubscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜\alpha_{k}italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and rate parameter aksubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜a_{k}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The joint likelihood of the observed counts xvâ¢dsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘x_{vd}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the latent variables (hd,zd)subscriptâ„ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘(h_{d},z_{d})( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is then given by

pâ¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Î±)=(âˆvğŸ™âˆ‘kzvâ¢kâ¢d=xvâ¢d)â¢âˆkpâ¢(hkâ¢d|Î±k,ak)â¢âˆv,kpâ¢(zvâ¢kâ¢d|W,hd),ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘ğ‘Šğ›¼subscriptproductğ‘£subscript1subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptproductğ‘˜ğ‘conditionalsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptproductğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘ğ‘Šsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘p(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha)=\Big{(}\prod_{v}\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{k}z_{vkd}=x_{% vd}}\Big{)}\prod_{k}p(h_{kd}|\alpha_{k},a_{k})\prod_{v,k}p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d}),italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Î± ) = ( âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where

pâ¢(hkâ¢d|Î±k,ak)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜\displaystyle p(h_{kd}|\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =akÎ±kÎ“â¢(Î±k)â¢hkâ¢dÎ±kâˆ’1â¢eâˆ’akâ¢hkâ¢d,absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\displaystyle=\frac{a_{k}^{\alpha_{k}}}{\Gamma(\alpha_{k})}h_{kd}^{\alpha_{k}-% 1}e^{-a_{k}h_{kd}},= divide start_ARG italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

denote the density of the Gamma distribution and probability mass function of the Poisson distribution, respectively. Similar to the Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA model, the introduction of the Gamma prior on the topic weights results in an intractable posterior distribution of the latent variables. We apply variational inference and approximate the true posterior with a variational distribution qğ‘qitalic_q given by

qdâ¢(hd,zd|Î²d,bd,Ï•d)subscriptğ‘ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘‘\displaystyle q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d})italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆkqâ¢(hkâ¢d|Î²kâ¢d,bkâ¢d)â¢âˆvqâ¢(zvâ¢d|xvâ¢d,Ï•vâ¢d),absentsubscriptproductğ‘˜ğ‘conditionalsubscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptproductğ‘£ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘‘\displaystyle=\prod_{k}q(h_{kd}|\beta_{kd},b_{kd})\prod_{v}q(z_{vd}|x_{vd},% \phi_{vd}),= âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where (Î²kâ¢d,bkâ¢d)subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘(\beta_{kd},b_{kd})( italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Ï•vâ¢dsubscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘‘\phi_{vd}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are Gamma and multinomial parameters, respectively. for

and the digamma function Ïˆğœ“\psiitalic_Ïˆ, cf.Â [6, eq.Â (14)]. Identically to the Dirichletâ€“Poisson model, the second term reduces to

ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(xd,zd|W,hd)]=âˆ‘v,kÏ•vâ¢kâ¢dâ¢xvâ¢dâ¢logâ¡(wvâ¢kâ¢h~kâ¢d)âˆ’âˆ‘kğ”¼qâ¢[hkâ¢d]âˆ’âˆ‘v,kğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡zvâ¢kâ¢d!],subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘‘ğ‘Šsubscriptâ„ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscript~â„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]subscriptğ‘§ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(x_{d},z_{d}|W,h_{d})\right]=\sum_{v,% k}\phi_{vkd}x_{vd}\log(w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd})-\sum_{k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left% [h_{kd}\right]-\sum_{v,k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log z_{vkd}!\right],blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! ] ,

and the last term is given by

Finally, the variational lower bound of the Gammaâ€“Poisson model is

We again assume that the prior parameters (Î±,a)ğ›¼ğ‘(\alpha,a)( italic_Î± , italic_a ) are fixed during model training. Optimizing the variational lower bound with respect to the topics WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the variational parameters Ï•vâ¢dâˆˆÎ”Kâˆ’1subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptÎ”ğ¾1\phi_{vd}\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT works identically to the derivation of the VI algorithm of the Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA model, and their update equations are given by wvâ¢kâˆâˆ‘dxvâ¢dâ¢Ï•vâ¢kâ¢dproportional-tosubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘w_{vk}\propto\sum_{d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Ï•vâ¢kâ¢dâˆwvâ¢kâ¢h~kâ¢dproportional-tosubscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘£ğ‘˜subscript~â„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\phi_{vkd}\propto w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. (Ïˆâ€²â¢(Î²kâ¢d)âˆ’1bkâ¢dâˆ’1bkâ¢dÎ²kâ¢dbkâ¢d2)â¢(Î±k+âˆ‘vxvâ¢dâ¢Ï•vâ¢kâ¢dâˆ’Î²kâ¢dak+1âˆ’bkâ¢d)=(00),matrixsuperscriptğœ“â€²subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘2matrixsubscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘matrix00\begin{pmatrix}\psi^{\prime}(\beta_{kd})&-\frac{1}{b_{kd}}\\ -\frac{1}{b_{kd}}&\frac{\beta_{kd}}{b_{kd}^{2}}\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}% \alpha_{k}+\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}-\beta_{kd}\\ a_{k}+1-b_{kd}\end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix}0\\ 0\end{pmatrix},( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_Ïˆ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ) ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 - italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ) = ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ) ,

which yields the update equations Î²kâ¢d=Î±k+âˆ‘vxvâ¢dâ¢Ï•vâ¢kâ¢dsubscriptğ›½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘£subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘£ğ‘‘subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘£ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\beta_{kd}=\alpha_{k}+\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}italic_Î² start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and bkâ¢d=1+aksubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜b_{kd}=1+a_{k}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Rewriting the updates involving Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• in the familiar multiplicative form, we obtain AlgorithmÂ 7. Notice that for fixed prior parameters (Î±,a)ğ›¼ğ‘(\alpha,a)( italic_Î± , italic_a ) and aside from the trivially estimated variational parameters bğ‘bitalic_b, the only difference between AlgorithmÂ 7 and the Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA AlgorithmÂ 5 is the explicit formula for ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡hkâ¢d].subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right].blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .

Before concretizing the algorithmic equivalence of the Gammaâ€“Poisson and Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA VI algorithms, let us recall that the Gammaâ€“Poisson model with rate parameters ak=asubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘a_{k}=aitalic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a extends the generative model of LDA by also modeling the total counts of words in a document.

Lemma E.1 ([6, Lemma 1]).

Let Î±âˆˆâ„>0Kğ›¼subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾absent0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Î± âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ak=a>0subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘0a_{k}=a>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Let the model parameter be WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then the following two models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    hkâˆ¼Î“â¢(Î±k,a)similar-tosubscriptâ„ğ‘˜Î“subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜ğ‘h_{k}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a)italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ roman_Î“ ( italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) independent,
    Xv=Poissonâ¡((Wâ¢h)v)subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘£Poissonsubscriptğ‘Šâ„ğ‘£X_{v}=\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. (ii)

    hâˆ¼Dirâ¡(Î±)similar-toâ„Dirğ›¼h\sim\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)italic_h âˆ¼ roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ),
    Nâˆ¼Poissonâˆ’âˆ’Gammaâ¡(âˆ‘kÎ±k,a)N\sim\operatorname{Poisson--Gamma}(\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)italic_N âˆ¼ start_OPFUNCTION roman_Poisson - - roman_Gamma end_OPFUNCTION ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ),
    Xâˆ¼Multinomialâ¡(N,p=Wâ¢h)similar-toğ‘‹Multinomialğ‘ğ‘ğ‘Šâ„X\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p=Wh)italic_X âˆ¼ roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ).

Proof.

For simplicity, we denote the value of the density of the Dirichlet distribution at hâˆˆÎ”Kâˆ’1â„subscriptÎ”ğ¾1h\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_h âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by Dirâ¡(Î±)â¢(h)Dirğ›¼â„\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ) ( italic_h ), and we use the analogous notation for the probability densities of the Gamma, Poisson, Poissonâ€“Gamma and multinomial distributions, respectively. We also use the abbreviations PoisPois\operatorname{Pois}roman_Pois and â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M to refer to the Poisson and multinomial distributions. With this notation, one can show

pâ¢(x|W,Î±,a)=(âˆ«Î”Kâˆ’1Dirâ¡(Î±)â¢(h)â¢â„³â¢(âˆ‘vxv,p=Wâ¢h)â¢(x)â¢ğ‘‘h)â¢(âˆ«â„>0Poisâ¡(Î»)â¢(âˆ‘vxv)â¢Î“â¢(âˆ‘kÎ±k,a)â¢(Î»)â¢ğ‘‘Î»)=(âˆ«Î”Kâˆ’1Dirâ¡(Î±)â¢(h)â¢â„³â¢(âˆ‘vxv,p=Wâ¢h)â¢(x)â¢ğ‘‘h)â¢Poissonâˆ’âˆ’Gammaâ¡(âˆ‘kÎ±k,a)â¢(âˆ‘vxv)=câ¢(x,âˆ‘kÎ±k,a)â¢(âˆ«Î”Kâˆ’1Dirâ¡(Î±)â¢(h)â¢âˆvPoisâ¡((Wâ¢h)v)â¢(xv)â¢dâ¢h)\begin{split}&p(x|W,\alpha,a)\\ &=\bigg{(}\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\mathcal{M}(% \textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v},p=Wh)(x)dh\bigg{)}\bigg{(}\displaystyle\int_{\mathbb{R% }_{>0}}\operatorname{Pois}(\lambda)(\textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v})\Gamma(\textstyle% \sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)(\lambda)d\lambda\bigg{)}\\ &=\bigg{(}\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\mathcal{M}(% \textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v},p=Wh)(x)\,dh\bigg{)}\operatorname{Poisson--Gamma}(% \textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)(\textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v})\\ &=c(x,\textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)\bigg{(}\displaystyle\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}% \operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\prod_{v}\operatorname{Pois}((Wh)_{v})(x_{v})\,dh% \bigg{)}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL italic_p ( italic_x | italic_W , italic_Î± , italic_a ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ) ( italic_h ) caligraphic_M ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ) ( italic_x ) italic_d italic_h ) ( âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Pois ( italic_Î» ) ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_Î“ ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) ( italic_Î» ) italic_d italic_Î» ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ) ( italic_h ) caligraphic_M ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ) ( italic_x ) italic_d italic_h ) start_OPFUNCTION roman_Poisson - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Î± ) ( italic_h ) âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Pois ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_h ) end_CELL end_ROW (34)

for both generative models. The details of the proof are based on the fact that normalized independent Gamma-distributed random variables with identical rate parameter follow a Dirichlet distribution, see [6, Lemma 1]. âˆ

The Bayesian analogue of LemmaÂ 4.2 is the following result.

Corollary E.2.

Let Î±âˆˆâ„>0Kğ›¼subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾absent0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Î± âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ak=a>0subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘0a_{k}=a>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Then the Gammaâ€“Poisson and Dirichletâ€“Poisson / LDA likelihoods have the same optima WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1K.ğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}.italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Proof.

By (34), the likelihoods are identical up to a constant câ¢(X,âˆ‘kÎ±k,a)ğ‘ğ‘‹subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ›¼ğ‘˜ğ‘c(X,\textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)italic_c ( italic_X , âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ). âˆ

Finally, the Bayesian analogue of CorollaryÂ B.2 is the following result.

Corollary E.4.

Let Xâˆˆâ„+VÃ—Dğ‘‹subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ·X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Î±âˆˆâ„>0K,ak=a>0formulae-sequenceğ›¼subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾absent0subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0},\,a_{k}=a>0italic_Î± âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Let (Wâˆ—,Î²âˆ—,bâˆ—,Ï•âˆ—)superscriptğ‘Šsuperscriptğ›½superscriptğ‘superscriptitalic-Ï•(W^{*},\beta^{*},b^{*},\phi^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Î² start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Ï• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point the Gammaâ€“Poisson VI algorithm. Proof.

Follows from LemmaÂ E.3 and the update equations of bğ‘bitalic_b and Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï•. âˆ

Appendix F Sparse NMF

In this section, we first provide details to the derivation of the joint update rules for Lasso-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraints on columns of Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W. We then prove that Lasso-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and an â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W (24) does not induce any sparsity. Finally, we generalize [34, Lemma 1 and 2] and show that any normalization constraints on the columns of W and penalty terms on H are competing regularizers on the two matrices.

Let us denote the objective function of â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and hyperparameter Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0 by

DKLÎ»(X||WH)â‰”DKL(X||WH)+Î»âˆ¥Hâˆ¥1.D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,WH)\coloneqq D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH)+\lambda\|% H\|_{1}.italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) â‰” italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_H âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Using CorollaryÂ A.3 and WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, a joint auxiliary function of DKLÎ»superscriptsubscriptğ·KLğœ†D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is given by

Applying the method of Lagrange multipliers, the auxiliary function can be jointly optimized in Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W and Hğ»Hitalic_H, and the objective function value is non-increasing under the following joint updates:

start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .
Lemma 6.1.

Let (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of NMF with an â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W (18) and let Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0. Then (W,11+Î»â¢H)ğ‘Š11ğœ†ğ»(W,\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)( italic_W , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Î» end_ARG italic_H ) is a solution of Lasso-penalized NMF with an â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint (24). Conversely, let (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of (24). Then (W,(1+Î»)â¢H)ğ‘Š1ğœ†ğ»(W,(1+\lambda)H)( italic_W , ( 1 + italic_Î» ) italic_H ) is a solution of (18).

Proof.

Notice that for any pair (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with WâˆˆÎ”Vâˆ’1Kğ‘ŠsuperscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘‰1ğ¾W\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W âˆˆ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have

DKLÎ»(X||W11+Î»H)=DKL(X||WH)+log(1+Î»)âˆ‘v,dxvâ¢d,DKL(X||W(1+Î»)H)=DKLÎ»(X||WH)âˆ’log(1+Î»)âˆ‘v,dxvâ¢d.\begin{split}D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)&=D_{\text{% KL}}(X\,||\,WH)+\log(1+\lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd},\\ D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,W(1+\lambda)H)&=D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,WH)-\log(1% +\lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Î» end_ARG italic_H ) end_CELL start_CELL = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î» ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W ( 1 + italic_Î» ) italic_H ) end_CELL start_CELL = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î» ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (35)

The result can now be shown using a proof by contradiction. Let (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of (18) and assume that (W,11+Î»â¢H)ğ‘Š11ğœ†ğ»(W,\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)( italic_W , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Î» end_ARG italic_H ) is not a solution of â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-penalized NMF (24). Then there exists (Wâˆ—,Hâˆ—)superscriptğ‘Šsuperscriptğ»(W^{*},H^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) with DKLÎ»(X||Wâˆ—Hâˆ—)<DKLÎ»(X||W11+Î»H)D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})<D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W% \tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Î» end_ARG italic_H ). Applying (35), it follows

DKL(X||Wâˆ—(1+Î»)Hâˆ—)\displaystyle D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,W^{*}(1+\lambda)H^{*})italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_Î» ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) =DKLÎ»(X||Wâˆ—Hâˆ—)âˆ’log(1+Î»)âˆ‘v,dxvâ¢d\displaystyle=D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})-\log(1+\lambda)\sum_{% v,d}x_{vd}= italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î» ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
<DKLÎ»(X||W11+Î»H)âˆ’log(1+Î»)âˆ‘v,dxvâ¢d\displaystyle<D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)-\log(1+% \lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}< italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Î» end_ARG italic_H ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î» ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=DKL(X||WH),\displaystyle=D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH),= italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) ,

which is a contradiction to (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) being a solution of (18). The proof of the second statement is identical. âˆ

More generally, let us now consider any reconstruction error D(X||WH)D(X||WH)italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) with D:â„+VÃ—DÃ—â„+VÃ—Dâ†’â„+:ğ·â†’subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ·subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ·subscriptâ„D:\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}\to\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_D : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, any regularizer Râ¢(H)ğ‘…ğ»R(H)italic_R ( italic_H ) with R:â„+KÃ—Dâ†’â„+:ğ‘…â†’subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ·subscriptâ„R:\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}\to\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_R : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and any normalization constraint Wâˆˆğ”¸pğ‘Šsubscriptğ”¸ğ‘W\in\mathbb{A}_{p}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where 0<p<âˆ0ğ‘0<p<\infty0 < italic_p < âˆ and

ğ”¸p={Wâˆˆâ„+VÃ—K|âˆ€k:â€–wkâ€–p=1}subscriptğ”¸ğ‘conditional-setğ‘Šsubscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ¾:for-allğ‘˜subscriptnormsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘˜ğ‘1\mathbb{A}_{p}=\{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\,|\,\forall k:\|w_{k}\|_{p}=1\}blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | âˆ€ italic_k : âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 }

denotes the set non-negative matrices with â„“psubscriptâ„“ğ‘\ell_{p}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-normalized columns. The goal is to solve the following sparse NMF problem

minWâˆˆğ”¸p,Hâˆˆâ„+KÃ—DD(X||WH)+R(H).\min_{W\in\mathbb{A}_{p},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||\,WH)+R(H).roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) . (36)

In the special cases of beta divergence reconstruction errors, Lasso- or log-regularizers Râ¢(H)=Î»â¢â€–Hâ€–1ğ‘…ğ»ğœ†subscriptnormğ»1R(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{1}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_H âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or Râ¢(H)=Î»â¢âˆ‘k,dlogâ¡(hkâ¢d)ğ‘…ğ»ğœ†subscriptğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ‘‘R(H)=\lambda\sum_{k,d}\log(h_{kd})italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Î» âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), and â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-normalized Wâˆˆğ”¸1ğ‘Šsubscriptğ”¸1W\in\mathbb{A}_{1}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it has been shown that (36) is equivalent to an optimization problem without any normalization constraints on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W [34, Lemma 1 and 2]. We now generalize this result to (36).

Let us introduce the normalization matrix Dpâ¢(W)â‰”diagâ¢(â€–w1â€–p,â€¦,â€–wKâ€–p)âˆˆâ„+KÃ—Kâ‰”subscriptğ·ğ‘ğ‘Šdiagsubscriptnormsubscriptğ‘¤1ğ‘â€¦subscriptnormsubscriptğ‘¤ğ¾ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ¾D_{p}(W)\coloneqq\text{diag}(\|w_{1}\|_{p},\ldots,\|w_{K}\|_{p})\in\mathbb{R}^% {K\times K}_{+}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) â‰” diag ( âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the optimization problem

minWâˆˆâ„+VÃ—K,Hâˆˆâ„+KÃ—DD(X||WH)+R(Dp(W)H).\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||% \,WH)+R(D_{p}(W)H).roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) . (37)

Then the optimization problems (36) and (37) are equivalent in the sense that every solution of (36) is a solution of (37) and normalized solutions of (37) are solutions of (36).

Theorem F.1 (cf.Â [34, Lemma 1 and 2]).

Let Xâˆˆâ„+VÃ—Dğ‘‹subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ·X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let (W,H)âˆˆğ”¸pÃ—â„+KÃ—Dğ‘Šğ»subscriptğ”¸ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ·(W,H)\in\mathbb{A}_{p}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (36). Then (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) is a solution of (37). Conversely, let (W,H)âˆˆâ„+VÃ—KÃ—â„+KÃ—Dğ‘Šğ»subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ¾subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ·(W,H)\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (37). Then (Wâ¢Dpâ¢(W)âˆ’1,Dpâ¢(W)â¢H)ğ‘Šsubscriptğ·ğ‘superscriptğ‘Š1subscriptğ·ğ‘ğ‘Šğ»(WD_{p}(W)^{-1},D_{p}(W)H)( italic_W italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) is a solution of (36).

Proof.

Let (W,H)âˆˆğ”¸pÃ—â„+KÃ—Dğ‘Šğ»subscriptğ”¸ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ·(W,H)\in\mathbb{A}_{p}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (36). Assume there exists (Wâˆ—,Hâˆ—)âˆˆâ„+VÃ—KÃ—â„+KÃ—Dsuperscriptğ‘Šsuperscriptğ»subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‰ğ¾subscriptsuperscriptâ„ğ¾ğ·(W^{*},H^{*})\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with

D(X||Wâˆ—Hâˆ—)+R(Dp(Wâˆ—)Hâˆ—)<D(X||WH)+R(Dp(W)H)=D(X||WH)+R(H).D(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})+R(D_{p}(W^{*})H^{*})<D(X\,||\,WH)+R(D_{p}(W)H)=D(X\,||\,% WH)+R(H).italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) = italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) .

Then the normalized matrices (W~,H~)~ğ‘Š~ğ»(\widetilde{W},\widetilde{H})( over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG , over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) with W~=Wâˆ—â¢Dpâˆ’1â¢(Wâˆ—)~ğ‘Šsuperscriptğ‘Šsuperscriptsubscriptğ·ğ‘1superscriptğ‘Š\widetilde{W}=W^{*}D_{p}^{-1}(W^{*})over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and H~=Dpâ¢(Wâˆ—)â¢Hâˆ—~ğ»subscriptğ·ğ‘superscriptğ‘Šsuperscriptğ»\widetilde{H}=D_{p}(W^{*})H^{*}over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT fulfill

D(X||W~H~)+R(H~)<D(X||WH)+R(H),D(X\,||\,\widetilde{W}\widetilde{H})+R(\widetilde{H})<D(X\,||WH)+R(H),italic_D ( italic_X | | over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) + italic_R ( over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) < italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) ,

contradicting that (W,H)ğ‘Šğ»(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) is a solution of (36). The proof of the second statement is analogous. âˆ

Example.

Let 0<p,q<âˆformulae-sequence0ğ‘ğ‘0<p,q<\infty0 < italic_p , italic_q < âˆ and consider (36) with Wâˆˆğ”¸pğ‘Šsubscriptğ”¸ğ‘W\in\mathbb{A}_{p}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Râ¢(H)=Î»â¢â€–Hâ€–qqğ‘…ğ»ğœ†superscriptsubscriptnormğ»ğ‘ğ‘R(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{q}^{q}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_H âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for some weight Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0. Then

minWâˆˆğ”¸p,Hâˆˆâ„+KÃ—DD(X||WH)+Î»âˆ¥Hâˆ¥qq\min_{W\in\mathbb{A}_{p},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||\,WH)+\lambda% \|H\|_{q}^{q}roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_H âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

is equivalent to

minWâˆˆâ„+VÃ—K,Hâˆˆâ„+KÃ—DD(X||WH)+Î»âˆ‘kâˆ¥wkâˆ¥pqâˆ¥hkTâˆ¥qq.\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||% \,WH)+\lambda\sum_{k}\|w_{k}\|_{p}^{q}\|h_{k}^{T}\|_{q}^{q}.roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V Ã— italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K Ã— italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Î» âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

This result demonstrates that the normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W and the regularizer Râ¢(H)ğ‘…ğ»R(H)italic_R ( italic_H ) are competing penalties.

Example ([34]).

Let p=1ğ‘1p=1italic_p = 1 and consider (36) with the beta divergence D=DÎ²ğ·subscriptğ·ğ›½D=D_{\beta}italic_D = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î² end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Î²âˆˆâ„ğ›½â„\beta\in\mathbb{R}italic_Î² âˆˆ blackboard_R, Wâˆˆğ”¸1ğ‘Šsubscriptğ”¸1W\in\mathbb{A}_{1}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and Râ¢(H)=Î»â¢â€–Hâ€–1ğ‘…ğ»ğœ†subscriptnormğ»1R(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{1}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_H âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for some weight Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0. Then

is equivalent to

suggesting that a Lasso penalty on Hğ»Hitalic_H together with an â„“1subscriptâ„“1\ell_{1}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W induces mutual sparsity [34]. However, LemmaÂ 6.1 proves that there is no effect on the sparsity in the case Î²=1ğ›½1\beta=1italic_Î² = 1, demonstrating that the effect on the sparsity also depends on the reconstruction error.
